title: M8 motorway (Scotland)
summary: The M8 is the busiest motorway in Scotland and one of the busiest in the United Kingdom.[1] It connects the country's two largest cities, Glasgow and Edinburgh, and serves other large communities including Airdrie, Coatbridge, Greenock, Livingston and Paisley. The motorway is 60 miles (97Â km) long. A major construction project to build the final section between Newhouse and Baillieston was completed on 30 April 2017.  The motorway has one service station, named Heart of Scotland Services, previously Harthill due to its proximity to the village.
